content.rendered:
The HLAA 2024 Convention has Concluded

HLAA’s first resort-style convention in Phoenix was a smashing success! More than 500 participants from around the U.S. and beyond converged at the luxurious Sheraton Grand Resort at Wild Horse Pass, June 26–29, 2024, to learn, engage and connect. If you were there, thank you for joining us! We’ll be updating this page soon with photos from some of the wonderful sessions, workshops and social events. Stay tuned!

  • Keynote speaker Shanna Adamic inspired the audience to “Audacious Optimism” at the General Session.
  • Experts discussed all sides of The Emotional Side of Hearing Loss at our Research Symposium.
  • Attendees had fun celebrating and connecting at the Welcome Back Bash and HLAA Awards.
  • With more than 30 educational workshops on a wide range of topics, there was something for everyone!
  • Hearing loss technology product demonstrations included Auracast™ Bluetooth® listening systems.
  • The popular Exhibit Hall featured cutting-edge tech and leading hearing health companies. 
  • Chapter and state leaders developed their skills at the HLAA Leadership Training.

Join Us in Indianapolis, June 12-14, 2025!

We hope to see you next year in the Midwest, so start planning now. HLAA’s annual, communication-accessible convention is designed to support hundreds of people with hearing loss from all walks of life around the United States. It’s the largest national gathering designed to empower individuals and families facing hearing loss. Attendees include:

  • Adults who are brand-new to HLAA and the experience of hearing loss
  • Previous participants who want to stay on top of the latest developments
  • Parents of children who live with some degree of hearing loss
  • Working professionals, students, retirees and veterans of all ages
  • Hearing care providers, assistive technology developers and industry experts
  • Anyone looking to find support and make connections in the hearing loss community

A Resort-Style Adventure on Native Land

This year, we traded the usual big-city experience for a beautiful southwest oasis in the Valley of the Sun: the Sheraton Grand at Wild Horse Pass. When attendees were not learning, discovering new technology or connecting with new and old friends, they had opportunities to explore the rich indigenous culture of the Gila River Indian community, relax at the luxurious spa, play golf, ride horses, kayak or paddleboard and dine at several high-quality restaurants on-site. 

Research Symposium

HLAA’s 30th annual Research Symposium focused on The Emotional Side of Hearing Loss on Friday, June 28.

LEARN MORE

General Session, June 28

The keynote was delivered by Shanna Adamic, an inspirational speaker, corporate executive and author who champions the power of “Audacious Optimism” to navigate life’s disruptions and achieve success. She shared her personal journey of overcoming adversity—including a life-threatening acoustic neuroma that caused hearing loss in her left ear—highlighting the transformative impact of a positive mindset. 

VIEW GENERAL SESSION

Celebrate! Awards Gala, June 29

The HLAA 2024 Awards Ceremony and Reception recognized honorees for their high caliber of leadership, commitment and dedication to people with hearing loss and to HLAA.  

VIEW AWARD RECIPIENTS
